subject: Productivity
title: The Four-Day Work Week Experiments
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Four-Day Work Week Experiments.

hook.text: Iceland tested a four-day work week from 2015 to 2019. The results surprised the world.

buildup.text: Over 2,500 workers cut hours with no pay reduction. Researchers tracked productivity closely.

discovery.text: Productivity stayed the same or improved. Worker wellbeing rose dramatically across all metrics.

twist.text: The UK ran a similar trial in 2022. Ninety-two percent of companies chose to keep the shorter week.

climax.text: The five-day week was never scientifically designed. It may simply be an industrial-era leftover.

punchline.text: Five days might have been a habit, not a necessity.

quiz.question: What did Iceland's four-day work week trial find?
options: Productivity stayed the same or improved
Workers demanded to return to five days
